text:
you can only use `.text` on a single element, not a list.
Try accessing the list by index `beautifulsoup.select('selector)[0].text`
If that returns the desired output, you can then iterate over the list by replacing the `[0]` with a variable that iterates over the list

elements.text: you can only use
.text

on a single element, not a list.
Try accessing the list by index
beautifulsoup.select('selector)[0].text
If that returns the desired output, you can then iterate over the list by replacing the
with a variable that iterates over the list

text:
here’s an example, although maybe not 100% fitting it might help:
```artist_list = soup.findAll("span", {"class": "chart-element__information__artist"})
artists = []
for artist in artist_list:
    artists.append(artist.text)
artists```

elements.text: here’s an example, although maybe not 100% fitting it might help:

artist_list = soup.findAll("span", {"class": "chart-element__information__artist"})
artists = []
for artist in artist_list:
    artists.append(artist.text)
artists

iterations = range(1,502,50)

text: range goes from 1 stopping at 502 in steps of 50

elements.text: range goes from 1 stopping at 502 in steps of 50

text: why 502? if we have 533 titles in pages from 1-50

elements.text: why 502? if we have 533 titles in pages from 1-50

text: i get the 50 but the 502? should not be 533?

elements.text: i get the 50 but the 502? should not be 533?

text: because the url has only the starting number

elements.text: because the url has only the starting number

text: the number in the urls are 1,51,101..... andthe last page that goes from 501 to 533 is the one labled as 501

elements.text: the number in the urls are 1,51,101..... andthe last page that goes from 501 to 533 is the one labled as 501

text: ahhhhhh

elements.text: ahhhhhh

text: and as range does not include the upper limit, you cant finish it in 501 but 502. You could put 533 too but it wouldnt make any difference
